intro: Chamaeleon macrocephalus, commonly known as the large-headed chamaeleon, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive, enlarged central disk. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
